title: [Large-scale] Blended Social Education Course Design Utilizing the Trialogic Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Educational Theories and Understanding of Social Studies Curriculum Content
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment is provided for pre-service and in-service teachers to strengthen social studies competencies, integrating online (theory) and offline (practice/simulation) components.

learning_goals: Learners enhance collaborative knowledge-building skills in real-world social problem-solving simulations by applying the Trialogic learning approach.

Learners perform two VR-based scenarios (voting simulation for democratic decision-making and virtual community conflict resolution) using a VR educational tool (e.g., "Social VR Simulator") and write implementation reports meeting at least four of five evaluation checklist items per scenario.

Participants revise a draft educational design two or more times reflecting formative feedback from three sessions over two weeks, achieving an "average" or higher grade in four of five rubric criteria for the final design.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
